page.title: 16SANDS FARM
page.content: ONE OF THE LAST SMALL FARMS IN EASTERTON TO TOTALLY SUPPORT A FAMILY, SANDS FARM WAS ORIGINALLY A MARKET GARDEN LATER BECAME A DAIRY FARM AND FINALLY A PIG AND BEEF REARING UNIT. ELECTRICITY WAS BROUGHT TO THE FARM IN 1954 AND MAINS WATER IN 1970. PREVIOUSLY ALL WATER WAS DRAWN FROM A 125 FEET DEEP WELL. FARMING CEASED IN 1978 AND MOST OF THE LAND WAS SOLD AWAY LEAVING ONLY A SMALL ACREAGE FOR EXCERSING HORSES. DURING 1985 THE FARMHOUSE HAS BEEN EXTENDED AND ENLARGED, THEREBY MAKING IT INTO A SMALL COUNTRY RESIDENCE AND HIGH BLANK WOODEN FENCES HAVE REPLACED MATURE GARDEN HEDGES AND SHRUBS. DAIRY, COW SHEDS, PIG HOUSES AND BARNS ARE CURRENTLY BEING DEMOLISHED TO MAKE ROOM FOR STABLING AND OTHER ANCILLARY BUILDINGS FOR A PRIVATE RIDING EST.
